text: Satendra Singh Lohiya (born 6 July 1987) is an Indian paraswimmer. He has 70% in both legs but became known for long-distance sea swimming. He was awarded the Padma Shri in 2024 for his contribution to Indian sports. == Early life == Satendra was born in Bhind, Madhya Pradesh. He became disabled at 15 days old due to a medical condition. He was encouraged by IAS officer P. Narahari and trained under Dr. Virendra Dabas. He started competitive swimming in 2009. == Swimming achievements == * In 2018, Satendra and three other para swimmers from India crossed the English Channel in a relay in 12 hours and 26 minutes. * In 2019, he crossed the Catalina Channel in the United States in 11 hours and 34 minutes, making an Asian record. * In 2022, he completed the 36 km North Channel between Ireland and Scotland in icy waters as part of a relay team. * In 2023, he was part of a team that swam the English Channel two ways (72 km) in relay format. == Awards == He received: * Vikram Award (2014), top sports award of Madhya Pradesh. * Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award (2019), presented by President Ram Nath Kovind. * Padma Shri (2024) for contribution to sports. == Awareness Campaign == In 2023, he led a 4,320 km bike rally from Kanyakumari to Kashmir to raise awareness about disability rights and para sports. == Book == A biography titled A Life-Changing Approach was written by Devrishi in 2024, highlighting his life and motivation. == References == == Other websites == * Paralympic.org profile Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:swimmers
